satnav

Class SatNav

  • java.lang.Object
    • satnav.SatNav

  • public class SatNav
extends java.lang.Object
    A SatNav represents an instance of a satellite navigation system. It has a geographic road map (passed in the form of a RoadMap instance) and has methods for route finding
    Author:
    Simon Campbell

    • Method Detail

      • getRouteLength

        public int getRouteLength(java.lang.String[] route)
        This method gets the length of the given route
        Parameters:
        route - - an array of junctions to visit in order
        Returns:
        Length of the route specified by the junctions in route, taken in order. If a road from a junction to its successor in the route does not exist (i.e. the route is not possible) then this method returns Integer.MAX_VALUE as a flag value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a null or zero element array is passed as the route or if a junction is included that is not stored in the satnav's RoadMap

      • getShortestRouteLength

        public int getShortestRouteLength(java.lang.String originName,
                         java.lang.String destinationName)
        This method finds the shortest route from the origin to the destination if such a route exists.
        Parameters:
        originName - - the origin point for the planned route
        destinationName - - the destination point for the planned route
        Returns:
        the length of the shortest route from origin to destination. Returns Integer.MAX_VALUE if the location exists but there is not a route between them.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown location is used in input

      • getRouteCountWithJunctionCountUpperLimit

        public int getRouteCountWithJunctionCountUpperLimit(java.lang.String originName,
                                           java.lang.String destinationName,
                                           int maxJunctionCountOnRoute)
        This method gets the number of routes available from the origin to the destination which visits at most the provided maximum junction count
        Parameters:
        originName - - the origin point for any counted route
        destinationName - - the destination point for any counted route
        maxJunctionCountOnRoute - - the maximum number of junctions visited on any route
        Returns:
        The number of routes meeting the criteria
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the origin or destination junctions are not found in the map and if the maxJunctionCountOnRoute is non-positive

      • getRouteCountWithRouteLengthUpperLimit

        public int getRouteCountWithRouteLengthUpperLimit(java.lang.String originName,
                                         java.lang.String destinationName,
                                         int routeLengthUpperBound)
        This method gets the number of routes available from the origin to the destination which cover less than the provided maximum route length
        Parameters:
        originName - - the origin point for any counted route
        destinationName - - the destination point for any counted route
        routeLengthUpperBound - - the maximum length of any counted route
        Returns:
        The number of routes meeting the criteria
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the origin or destination junctions are not found in the map and if the maxRouteLength is non-positive

      • getRouteCountWithJunctionCount

        public int getRouteCountWithJunctionCount(java.lang.String originName,
                                 java.lang.String destinationName,
                                 int junctionCountOnRoute)
        /** This method gets the number of routes available from the origin to the destination which visits exactly the provided junction count
        Parameters:
        originName - - the origin point for any counted route
        destinationName - - the destination point for any counted route
        junctionCountOnRoute - - the maximum number of junctions visited on any route
        Returns:
        The number of routes meeting the criteria
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the origin or destination junctions are not found in the map and if the JunctionCountOnRoute is non-positive
